Orchestrating Single Cell Analyses With Bioconductor

title: Welcome to My Website
text:
I am Emanuele Pitino, PhD student in computational biology at Dr. Holger Heyn’s lab (CNAG, Barcelona), supported by a Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions (MSCA) fellowship.
My research focuses on leveraging single-cell genomics to identify clinically relevant markers in Cancer and Autoimmune Disorders, with a special interest in immune checkpoint inhibition therapy.
With a MSc in Systems Immunology (Sorbonne Université - Paris), I specialize in scRNA-seq, deep scTCR-seq and spatial transcriptomics, combining a collaborative and critical-thinking approach.
My goal: to contribute advancing our understanding of clinically relevant immune responses.

STAMP: Single-Cell Transcriptomics Analysis and Multimodal Profiling through Imaging

title: Scientific Posters
text:
Innovations in Single Cell Omics 2024
The landscape of Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) treatment has been transformed by the advent of immunotherapies targeting the programmed death 1 (PD-1) and programmed death-ligand 1 (PD-L1) (M. Reck, 2022). The effectiveness of such treatments is limited by the lack of reliable biomarkers for predicting therapeutic responses (G. Morad, 2021).
Here, we combined scRNA and deep TCR repertoire sequencing to explore clonal expansion in 15 NSCLC patients undergoing Immune Checkpoint Blockade (ICB) therapy (anti-PDL1).
